title: Cassava Cake Recipe
description: This cassava cake is a classic Filipino dessert made with few ingredients including fresh cassava root (yuca), coconut milk, condensed milk, and egg.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Cassava Cake 4.4 (56) 45 Reviews 21 Photos This cassava cake is a Pinoy dessert best served cold. It is easy to make if you are looking for a Filipino dessert. Submitted by lola Updated on June 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 21 21 21 21 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 5 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 2 cups grated, peeled yuca 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk 2 large eggs, beaten Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir yuca, coconut milk, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and eggs together in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour into a 2-quart baking dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 1 hour. Turn the broiler on and bake until top of cake is browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Cool completely in the refrigerator before serving, about 1 hour. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 138 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Cassava Cake 01 of 21 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 21 Photo by  CalmAle4922 06/01/2022 Double the grated cassava and it’ll be perfect 03 of 21 Photo by  Bing Frias 11/26/2020 04 of 21 Photo by  Malia 808 09/21/2020 05 of 21 Photo by  Ray Crisostomo 04/01/2020 As an experienced Baker, it came out perfectly although I set my oven at 300 degrees and baked an hour. I couldn't find macapuno coconut so I used 1 bag of coconut and 1 tablespoon of vanilla. 06 of 21 Photo by  Erin Sweets Melgar 11/16/2019 Super delicious! Used 3 packs of frozen cassava, drained in a colander for 30 minutes. Yielded 1:9x13 and 1: 8x8. Used the same amount of can products. Added 1 jar of macapuno (young coconut in syrup) did not drain. Lined pans with Parchment paper for easy cleanup. Baked for 1 hr 45 mins @350 degrees. Last 20 minutes added a thin layer of condense milk. Super easy and freaking delicious!! 07 of 21 Photo by  Erin Sweets Melgar 11/16/2019 Super delicious! Used 3 packs of frozen cassava, drained in a colander for 30 minutes. Yielded 1:9x13 and 1: 8x8. Used the same amount of can products. Added 1 jar of macapuno (young coconut in syrup) did not drain. Lined pans with Parchment paper for easy cleanup. Baked for 1 hr 45 mins @350 degrees. Last 20 minutes added a thin layer of condense milk. Super easy and freaking delicious!! 08 of 21 Photo by  Erin Sweets Melgar 11/16/2019 Super delicious! Used 3 packs of frozen cassava, drained in a colander for 30 minutes. Yielded 1:9x13 and 1: 8x8. Used the same amount of can products. Added 1 jar of macapuno (young coconut in syrup) did not drain. Lined pans with Parchment paper for easy cleanup. Baked for 1 hr 45 mins @350 degrees. Last 20 minutes added a thin layer of condense milk. Super easy and freaking delicious!! 09 of 21 Photo by  Edwin 09/25/2019 I stuck with the recipe butI used three cups instead of two or four of grated yucca and the cake had a nice consistency-any more would have been too much. Also, I baked it for 90 minutes in order for it to set. Next I’ll experiment with panela and grated coconut and maybe do one in chocolate... 10 of 21 Photo by  redcop 09/24/2019 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Mocha Chiffon Cake 5 Ratings Mamon (Sponge Cakes) 31 Ratings Buko (Young Coconut) Pie 8 Ratings Puto 22 Ratings Biko 25 Ratings Ube-Macapuno Cake 51 Ratings Palitaw (Sweet Rice Cakes) 12 Ratings Maja Blanca Maiz (Corn Pudding) 7 Ratings Barquillos (Wafer Rolls) 20 Ratings Champorado 11 Ratings Leche Flan 4 Ratings Maja Blanca (Coconut Pudding) 23 Ratings Lipardo's Puto Seco 17 Ratings Chocolate-Orange Rice Pudding 2 Ratings Turon (Plantain Egg Rolls) 2 Ratings Philippine Butter Cookies 22 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
